text: Jeanne Manet (born Gilberte Marcelle Lachmann; 27 November 1917 â€“ 15 January 2012) was a French movie actress.Troyan p.401 After appearing in some French movies, Manet moved to Hollywood. Originally called there as a rising starlet, her roles were generally supporting ones.Troyan, Michael. A Rose for Mrs. Miniver: The Life of Greer Garson. University Press of Kentucky, 1999. She was born in Houilles, France. == Career == Manet's career began in 1937. Her best known roles are in Long Live Liberty (1946), Slightly French (1949), Operation Mad Ball (1957), The Flying Fontaines (1959) and in Pepe (1960). She retired in 1961. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1917 births Category:2012 deaths Category:French movie actors
title: Jeanne Manet
